title: Lewis Hamilton returns to Instagram and insists he hasn't 'given up'
text:
Lewis Hamilton has shared an update with fans (Picture: Dan Mullan/Getty Images)

Just days after he had fans worried following a grim post about the state of the planet and feeling like ‘giving up on everything’, Lewis Hamilton has returned to Instagram to update followers.

The Mercedes champion focused on the positives and sent out happy vibes to his followers as he informed them that he hasn’t ‘given up’ and he was still ‘fighting’.

‘Good morning World. I just wanted to send a message of positivity to you,’ he began in the message shared via Instagram Story.

‘I hope your weeks been amazing and wishing you a great weekend. I appreciate all the positive vibes you’ve sent my way.’

He concluded: ‘I haven’t given up, I’m still right here fighting! #stillirise’

The message will surely be a welcome update for concerned fans after the now-deleted text he shared on Tuesday.

The F1 star insisted he hasn’t ‘given up’ and sent positive vibes to his followers (Picture: Getty Images Europe)

Lewis shared a lengthy statement about the state of the Earth and how it had upset him, as Extinction Rebellion protesters were ordered to stop demonstrating in London.

‘Hey world, I hope everyone’s enjoying their day,’ he wrote. ‘I’m sad right now with the thought of where this world is going.

‘Extinction of our race becoming more and more likely as we over use our resources. The world is a messed up place. World leaders either uneducated or don’t care about the environment at all.

The race car driver had celebrated a race win before sharing his emotional post about saving the planet (Picture: Lewishamilton/instagram)

‘Agriculture farming is the largest pollutant we currently have by over 50%, far more that our travel industry combined.

‘I’m sad to see so many people, even close friends ignore what is happening daily. Education is key and we were taught that eating animal products was good for us but we’ve been lied to for 100s of years.’

He added it had taken him 32 years to ‘understand the impact’ as he figured what he could do better to help.

Hey! For all those talking about @LewisHamilton and his cryptic messages – if read in context and in full I don’t think they’re that cryptic. Those publishing just the last message need to put it together with the others imho… #F1 #vegan #ClimateChange pic.twitter.com/sEqExiXSYd — Jennie Gow (@JennieGow) October 15, 2019

Wanting his life to ‘mean something’ the sportsman continued: ‘I urge you to do some research, find the compassion I know you have within you to recognise what you are contributing to in terms of what you eat which keeps the meat and dairy industry flourishing and therefore deforestation, animal cruelty, our seas and climate decaying on a daily basis.’

Lewis implored his followers to ‘go vegan’, claiming it was the ‘only way to truly save our planet today’.

It was his final message that seemed to worry many, as he ended with: ‘Honestly, I feel like giving up on everything. Shut down completely.

‘Why bother when the world is such a mess and people don’t seem to care. ‘I’m going to take a moment away to gather my thoughts. Thank you to those of you who do give a damn about the world.’
